abstract: Sam Roberts reviews board game New York 1901 and books 1,000 Foods to Eat Before You Die: A Food Lover’s Life List by Mimi Sheraton, Discovering the New York Craft Spirits Boom by Heather D Dolland and Elaine’s: The Rise of One of New York’s Most Legendary Restaurants From Those Who Were There by Amy Phillips Penn.
lead_paragraph: A review of a board game about Manhattan real estate in the early 20th century; an index of exotic foods; the story of the craft spirits boom in New York State; and anecdotes from Elaine’s, the former Upper East Side eatery.

headline.main: Bookshelf: Gilded-Age Version of Monopoly in New York
headline.print_headline: A Board Game, Flavors and Spirits

snippet: A review of a board game about Manhattan real estate in the early 20th century; an index of exotic foods; the story of the craft spirits boom in New York State; and anecdotes from Elaine’s, the former Upper East Side eatery.
